body:
Can you also please change the commit message to be more descriptive?

Also https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3247 will cause conflicts. Let any one PR be merged and the second PR can then rebase against master.
@r39132 there you go :) Thanks a lot for looking into this, also please let me know if I need to change anything.
thanks @r39132 - I have created new PR here - https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3275
@jmagana2000 something is off, please create a new commit from master

> The diff coverage is `n/a`.

Oops, I also fixed this is https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3277
Can you rebase onto master? Thanks!

Please rebase onto master. Thanks for picking this up. This will make @NielsZeilemaker happy :-)

Python 3 support is addressed in this ticket: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-1251
@berislavlopac can you rebase onto master? :)

Can you:
- Squash your commit into one single commit
- Adhere to the commit naming convention (prepend with `[AIRFLOW-1960]`)
- Rebase onto master

Done. Actually, I gave a tutorial on "Apache Airflow in the cloud" @ PyData London where some users who used Python3 had trouble installing Airflow with `gcp_api` extras.

So, I was looking into it and found this :)
@berislavlopac would be awesome if you can give it a spin. This should be in 1.10.0.
Maybe check if the requests can be mocked
Cool, let me know when you've finished the PR. Cheers

> Merging [#3273](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3273?src=pr&el=desc) into [master](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/commit/840930b4d0c545adc24d8eb040974f88370e081b?src=pr&el=desc) will **not change** coverage.
> The diff coverage is `n/a`.

[![Impacted file tree graph](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3273/graphs/tree.svg?token=WdLKlKHOAU&src=pr&width=650&height=150)](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3273?src=pr&el=tree)

[Continue to review full report at Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3273?src=pr&el=continue).
> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3273?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [840930b...77a9997](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3273?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

Apparently due to a packaging mishap with Flask `0.12.3`. According to  https://github.com/pallets/flask/issues/2728#issuecomment-384982064 a fixed `0.12.4` should come out soon.

Sadly, until that happens it also leaves https://dist.apache.org/repos/dist/dev/incubator/airflow/1.10.0beta1/ in a state where you need to manually pin Flask to 0.12.2 as in https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3277/commits/e1bfb684027a627fe7ffc6279adaafc45a6e3e39.

I'll point to this warning from the dev mailing list as well - to maybe save the trouble for someone else.

@Fokko thank you for applying the fix so fast to both `master` and `v1-10-test`. It saved me a few cycles!
@Fokko done
@jmagana2000  There is something pretty wrong with your PR. I'm closing. Please reopen after you have rebased your fork and do follow the contributor guidelines in the PR.
I'm closing this for now

cc @Fokko
@cloneluke Thx for the changes. Do you mind squashing your commits and rebasing?
Since we haven't heard back, I'm closing this.
Fixed in https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/2821. Closing.
@OElesin This PR looks a little crazy. A lot of files seem to be touched that don't need to be touched. I'm closing this. Please reopen it after falling the contrib guidelines.
+1 Sorry for the delay.
@r39132, I tried to merge all commits into one. I only touched the files I needed to. I guess I rebased wrongly which must have caused the issues.
@andscoop Kindly address comments and rebase!
@elipapa please rebase. I will take a look after.

Thanks for picking this up @kaxil! Could you also fix the Form in rbac/password_auth? Thanks:
```
Fokkos-MacBook-Pro:incubator-airflow fokkodriesprong$ grep -R 'wtforms[A-Za-z, ]*Form' .
./airflow/contrib/auth/backends/password_auth.py:from wtforms import Form, PasswordField, StringField
./airflow/www_rbac/views.py:from wtforms import Form, SelectField, validators
```
The files on Github:
https://github.com/kaxil/incubator-airflow/blob/AIRFLOW-2390/airflow/www_rbac/views.py#L50
https://github.com/kaxil/incubator-airflow/blob/AIRFLOW-2390/airflow/contrib/auth/backends/password_auth.py#L28

I'm still confused why the CI failed. Let me check: https://travis-ci.org/Fokko/incubator-airflow/builds/372642153

Thanks @jornh for the background information. Really appreciate it. Are there any specific from Flask 1.12.{3,4} features that you want to be in there?

For now pinning it onto the specific version is the best solution. We had some issues with upgrades of dependencies that broke the Airflow install earlier.
Please also add the hook and operator to the docs. Thanks!
Somewhere something went wrong, please open a new PR @OElesin. The AWS Glue hook feels for me something that should be in Airflow! Cheers

@Fokko regarding the Form in `rbac/password_auth`: It uses `wtforms` library which hasn't changed. The deprecation warning is in `flask_wtf` package which is the integration of `Flask` and `wtforms` package. 

Regarding the CI failure, it for some reason picked a previous commit in this PR which I fixed.
https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-airflow/builds/372542672

I closed & reopened this PR and now it the CI passes
@patsak Kindly look into making a change to sqlalchemy instead of airflow. Closing for now.
@Philippus Sorry for the delay in getting to this. Please rebase and I will merge. Thx. Also, squash commits.
@stellah This is a good fix. Can you add some tests and rebase?

Closing for inactivity! Reopen once you have tests.
Closing for inactivity! reopen once you rebase.
@Fokko kindly rebase

@bolkedebruin @Fokko I still need to do some clean up (and will also create some Jira tickets tomorrow), but here are the three things this PR does:

1. Makes some changes to allow the k8s executor to run outside of a kubernetes cluster. This will be really good for future development, but also just makes sense since the executor itself isn't exactly k8s dependent
2. Creates a "kube_run" command with unit tests. This command looks a lot like "test", except it records the state once the task is finished. Please let me know if there is a different way you would like me to handle this.
3. Allows users to specify if their airflow home is different on the workers than on the leader (which would often be the case for local development).

Lemme know what you think and I'll be sure to do some more for this tomorrow!
Done @r39132, I'll do another pass over the PR this week.

I've reverted the pinned version: https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/commit/e561ea64ccbcf54a5200fff322829fcfdccd1bf7 https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/commit/0ff434a9b7510fb9cb1e74a60c5ac02b61f087d5

I've did some tests and it looks fine again, thanks @davidism for the quick fix!
Not sure why unit test coverage dropped for `airflow/api/common/experimental/mark_tasks.py`, tests were added for it, any thoughts?
The code coverage report is sometimes a bit weird, I believe because it is compared with master. You can try to rebase and see if it changes. Cheers
I'll try to test it today.
@bolkedebruin @r39132 Fix the obsolete license header

I'm trying to install it as `-e git://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow.git@refs/pull/3259/merge#egg=apache-airflow` but I'm getting the `unknown revision or path not in the working tree` error. Any suggestions how to set it up?
I'm always using `pip install --upgrade git+https://github.com/yrqls21/incubator-airflow.git@kevin_yang_fix_s3_logging`
Thank you, this worked! And I can report that it's working, the logs are now being sent to GCP! :+1:
Should we just close this now that #3259 has been merged?

Hi @Fokko,

I'm a bit confused by your comments about the `kube_run`. The `kube_run` function wouldn't just be used for the tests but would also be used in the production k8s run. The idea is that there's no real reason to have a running scheduler on the workers since if the task dies the watcher would pick up the failure and report it back. Another option would be to add a `--kubernetes-mode` to the run function. But I found that having a second scheduler running on the workers just added a lot of extra logging and complexity/made it hard to debug why the tasks were reporting failures.
@r39132 Done!

@dimberman Ah I missed the `.replace("run", "kube_run")`, I'm sorry. I must admin that I'm not really fond of this solution. The local task worked last time checked, and this will also make the execution of tasks a bit simpler. Why did you decide to create a separate cli entry for this?

This is an important setting if you want to run airflow's webserver behind an AWS ELB where the `idle_timeout` defaults to 60 seconds and you need to have gunicorn's keep-alive longer than this timeout (it defaults to 2 seconds).

Setting the ELB's `idle_timeout` to 1 or 2 seconds doesn't work - many requests fail with a 504 response.

Unless I'm missing something, you can't run the Airflow webserver behind an ELB as it stands.

This looks like a case where a useful light-weight feature addition is killed by a request for a more complicated feature. Personally, I like the concept of altering an accent color to make it more obvious which environment someone is on. I have definitely been bitten by doing something on the wrong env -- and I'm pretty sure the submitter was also bitten by such an example. So, until interchangeable style sheets become a reality, perhaps we can be more open to this change.
